radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is enlarged measuring up to 1.6 cm with a markedly thickened wall and surrounding fat stranding and phlegmonous changes. There is a hypodense fluid collection adjacent to the appendix measuring 0.7 x 2.6 cm. There is free fluid in the pelvis. Lung bases are clear. Subcentimeter liver hypodensity likely represents a simple cyst. The pancreas, spleen, kidneys, and adrenal glands are normal. No evidence of mesenteric lymphadenopathy or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
